suggested_topics: the engineering of ancient Roman aqueducts
how mycelium networks share resources underground
the economics of food trucks in major cities
how coral reefs build their own weather systems

formats.name: imaginary_citation
formats.instruction: Invent a fake but plausible piece of research or survey, and pretend you are referencing it. One to two sentences. Make it quirky but convincing.

formats.name: micro_story
formats.instruction: Write a tiny narrative about a real or fictional moment that changed someone's day. Focus on action and emotional twist. Maximum three sentences.

formats.name: if_then_parallel
formats.instruction: Draw a parallel between two totally unrelated things by completing this structure: 'If X is like Y, then...'. Make the analogy surprising, with a brief explanation.

formats.name: data_dream
formats.instruction: Imagine and describe an alternate reality where a familiar statistic or social pattern is reversed. Explain what everyday life would look like in detail (one paragraph).

formats.name: slow_burn_rant
formats.instruction: Write a long, simmering rant about something that annoys you, but build your argument gradually and end on a reflective note. Minimum three paragraphs.

formats.name: object_interview
formats.instruction: Pretend you are interviewing a household item for its life story. Write the question and the object's reply (dialogue format). Keep it playful and relatable.

formats.name: reverse_advice
formats.instruction: Give advice that you actually wish you hadn’t followed, and explain the unintended consequences in detail. Structure: advice + story + lesson learned.

formats.name: future_echo
formats.instruction: Forecast an odd, hyper-specific trend you think will exist in 10 years. Describe scene, people, and daily interactions. One robust paragraph.

formats.name: time_capsule_fact
formats.instruction: Share a strange fact or observation you’d seal in a time capsule, and explain why you chose it. 2-3 sentences, combine fact and rationale.

title_styles: Write a title that starts with 'What if...' and ask an outlandish question.
Write a playful, interview-style title: 'We asked X about Y, and here’s what it said!'
Write a confessional title: 'I never thought I’d admit this about X…'
Write a timeline title: 'How X has changed from Y to Z'
Write a direct analogy title: 'If X is the new Y, what does that mean for Z?'
structure_variants: Alternate between narration and dialogue throughout.
Start with a vivid fictional scenario, then pivot to real-world parallels.
Build up the argument point by point, but conceal your conclusion until the very last line.
Begin with a short story or anecdote, then dissect it logically.
Use layered mini-sections, each with its own theme and tone.
topic_angles: Explore oddities of daily routines nobody talks about.
Debate the virtues and vices of modern devices from the device’s perspective.
Imagine alternative timelines for common cultural rituals.
Analyze how random internet trends influence offline behavior.
Investigate the hidden emotional lives of seemingly mundane jobs.
